Gracias a nuestra selección por lo que hicieron.\n\nAdemás el cantante colombiano también felicitó a la selección argentina después de conseguir el título número 15 de la Copa América, con el que se convierten en los máximos ganadores de la competición sudamericana al superar a Uruguay.\n\nTe recomendamos...", 'source': {'uri': 'mediotiempo.com', 'dataType': 'news', 'title': 'Medio Tiempo'}, 'authors': [{'uri': 'axel_gutierrez@mediotiempo.com', 'name': 'Áxel Gutiérrez', 'type': 'author', 'isAgency': False}], 'image': 'https://cdn2.mediotiempo.com/uploads/media/2024/07/17/maluma-sale-arreglar-polemica-pelea.jpg', 'eventUri': 'spa-3548132', 'sentiment': None, 'wgt': 458933360, 'relevance': 51}

{'uri': '8230425323', 'lang': 'eng', 'isDuplicate': True, 'date': '2024-07-17', 'time': '17:26:06', 'dateTime': '2024-07-17T17:26:06Z', 'dateTimePub': '2024-07-17T17:24:24Z', 'dataType': 'news', 'sim': 0, 'url': 'https://www.wbal.com/lionel-messi-asked-to-apologize-for-argentina-players-racist-chant/', 'title': "Lionel Messi asked to apologize for Argentina players' racist chant", 'body': 'Lionel Messi faced calls on Wednesday to apologize for racist chants made by Argentina\'s players after they won the Copa America.\n\nAn Argentinean government official said Messi, who is the team captain, and the president of the country\'s soccer federation, Claudio Tapia, should apologize after a video was shared on social media showing members of Argentina\'s triumphant squad singing a racist chant about French players with African heritage .\n\nMidfielder Enzo Fernandez said he was "truly sorry" for the incident and his Premier League club Chelsea said it had begun disciplinary action, describing discriminatory behavior as "completely unacceptable."\n\nIt is unclear from the video if Messi -- widely regarded as one of the greatest soccer players of all time -- participated in the chant. But Argentina\'s sports sub-secretary, Julio Garro, said he should say sorry.\n\n"The national team captain must also come out to apologize for this case. The same AFA (Argentina Football Association) president," Garro said in radio statements. "I think it is appropriate. It leaves us as a country in a bad position, with so much glory."\n\nArgentina beat Colombia 1-0 on Sunday at Miami Gardens, Florida. Afterwards a video posted on Instagram showed Fernandez and Argentina players chanting about France\'s team as they celebrated.\n\nThe same chants -- by some Argentina fans -- emerged before the team beat France in the World Cup final in 2022. The derogatory chants single out France players of African heritage, from several countries, and holding a French passport.\n\nFIFA said it was also looking into the incident after the French soccer federation pledged to file a complaint with the sport\'s world governing body over "racist and discriminatory remarks."\n\nChelsea\'s response comes after one of Fernandez\'s clubmates, France defender Wesley Fofana, posted the video on his social media accounts Tuesday and called it "uninhibited racism."\n\nFofana has family ties to Ivory Coast and is among several French players who are Black in the Chelsea first-team squad.\n\n"We are proud to be a diverse, inclusive club where people from all cultures, communities and identities feel welcome," Chelsea said in a statement Wednesday. "We acknowledge and appreciate our player\'s public apology and will use this as an opportunity to educate.\n\n"The Club has instigated an internal disciplinary procedure."\n\nFernandez apologized for "getting caught up in the euphoria of our Copa America celebrations."\n\n"That video, that moment, those words, do not reflect my beliefs or my character," he said on Instagram. "I am truly sorry."\n\nFernandez became the most expensive player in British soccer history after joining Chelsea from Benfica for 106.7 million pounds ($131.4 million) in 2023.\n\nFIFA President Gianni Infantino has said soccer and its 211 national federations must have a zero tolerance approach to racism and in May committed to relaunching a task force to monitor incidents.\n\n"FIFA is aware of a video circulating on social media and the incident is being looked into," the governing body said Wednesday. "FIFA strongly condemns any form of discrimination by anyone including players, fans and officials."\n\nIt is unclear what jurisdiction FIFA has over the incident on a team bus after a tournament, but the governing body likely could act if the Argentina federation\'s handling of the case is considered unsatisfactory.\n\n___\n\nDebora Rey contributed to this story from Buenos Aires', 'source': {'uri': 'wbal.com', 'dataType': 'news', 'title': 'WBAL'}, 'authors': [], 'image': 'https://dehayf5mhw1h7.cloudfront.net/wp-content/uploads/sites/2100/2023/06/06143349/wbal-logo.png', 'eventUri': None, 'sentiment': 0.06666666666666665, 'wgt': 458933166, 'relevance': 51}

El club ha puesto en marcha un procedimiento disciplinario interno", informó el club este miércoles.\n\nAhora, debido a lo establecido por el Código Disciplinario de la FIFA, Argentina podría sufrir una dura suspensión de cara a las eliminatorias rumbo al Mundial de Estados Unidos, Canadá y México 2026:\n\n"Toda persona que atente contra la dignidad o la integridad de un país, una persona o un colectivo de personas empleando palabras o acciones despectivas, discriminatorias o vejatorias por motivos de raza, color de piel, origen étnico, nacional o social, género, discapacidad, orientación sexual, lengua, religión, posicionamiento político o de cualquier otro estatus o razón será sancionada con una suspensión que durará al menos diez partidos o un periodo determinado, o con cualquier otra medida disciplinaria adecuada", aparece en parte del reglamento.\n\nLa FIFA también podría castigar tanto a la Asociación del Fútbol Argentino como a los jugadores que incurran en actos que alienten a la discriminación.', 'source': {'uri': 'colombia.com', 'dataType': 'news', 'title': 'Colombia.com'}, 'authors': [], 'image': 'https://cdn.colombia.com/sdi/2024/07/17/argentina-podria-quedarse-por-fuera-del-mundial-2026-luego-de-la-final-de-la-copa-america-2024-1247106.jpg', 'eventUri': None, 'sentiment': None, 'wgt': 458933097, 'relevance': 100}

{'uri': '8230425222', 'lang': 'eng', 'isDuplicate': True, 'date': '2024-07-17', 'time': '17:24:43', 'dateTime': '2024-07-17T17:24:43Z', 'dateTimePub': '2024-07-17T17:24:19Z', 'dataType': 'news', 'sim': 0, 'url': 'https://santamariatimes.com/ap/sports/lionel-messi-asked-to-apologize-for-argentina-players-racist-chant/article_b5ace387-f2a2-5597-a416-b7d75acd18d9.html', 'title': "Lionel Messi asked to apologize for Argentina players' racist chant", 'body': 'Lionel Messi faced calls on Wednesday to apologize for racist chants made by Argentina\'s players after they won the Copa America.\n\nAn Argentinean government official said Messi, who is the team captain, and the president of the country\'s soccer federation, Claudio Tapia, should apologize after a video was shared on social media showing members of Argentina\'s triumphant squad singing a racist chant about French players with African heritage.\n\nMidfielder Enzo Fernandez said he was "truly sorry" for the incident and his Premier League club Chelsea said it had begun disciplinary action, describing discriminatory behavior as "completely unacceptable."\n\nIt is unclear from the video if Messi -- widely regarded as one of the greatest soccer players of all time -- participated in the chant. But Argentina\'s sports sub-secretary, Julio Garro, said he should say sorry.\n\n"The national team captain must also come out to apologize for this case. The same AFA (Argentina Football Association) president," Garro said in radio statements. "I think it is appropriate. It leaves us as a country in a bad position, with so much glory."\n\nArgentina beat Colombia 1-0 on Sunday at Miami Gardens, Florida. Afterwards a video posted on Instagram showed Fernandez and Argentina players chanting about France\'s team as they celebrated.\n\nThe same chants -- by some Argentina fans -- emerged before the team beat France in the World Cup final in 2022. The derogatory chants single out France players of African heritage, from several countries, and holding a French passport.\n\nFIFA said it was also looking into the incident after the French soccer federation pledged to file a complaint with the sport\'s world governing body over "racist and discriminatory remarks."\n\nChelsea\'s response comes after one of Fernandez\'s clubmates, France defender Wesley Fofana, posted the video on his social media accounts Tuesday and called it "uninhibited racism."\n\nFofana has family ties to Ivory Coast and is among several French players who are Black in the Chelsea first-team squad.\n\n"We are proud to be a diverse, inclusive club where people from all cultures, communities and identities feel welcome," Chelsea said in a statement Wednesday. "We acknowledge and appreciate our player\'s public apology and will use this as an opportunity to educate.\n\n"The Club has instigated an internal disciplinary procedure."\n\nFernandez apologized for "getting caught up in the euphoria of our Copa America celebrations."\n\n"That video, that moment, those words, do not reflect my beliefs or my character," he said on Instagram. "I am truly sorry."\n\nFernandez became the most expensive player in British soccer history after joining Chelsea from Benfica for 106.7 million pounds ($131.4 million) in 2023.\n\nFIFA President Gianni Infantino has said soccer and its 211 national federations must have a zero tolerance approach to racism and in May committed to relaunching a task force to monitor incidents.\n\n"FIFA is aware of a video circulating on social media and the incident is being looked into," the governing body said Wednesday. "FIFA strongly condemns any form of discrimination by anyone including players, fans and officials."\n\nIt is unclear what jurisdiction FIFA has over the incident on a team bus after a tournament, but the governing body likely could act if the Argentina federation\'s handling of the case is considered unsatisfactory.\n\nDebora Rey contributed to this story from Buenos Aires\n\nJames Robson is at https://twitter.com/jamesalanrobson\n\nAP soccer: https://apnews.com/hub/soccer', 'source': {'uri': 'santamariatimes.com', 'dataType': 'news', 'title': 'Santa Maria Times'}, 'authors': [{'uri': 'james_robson@santamariatimes.com', 'name': 'James Robson', 'type': 'author', 'isAgency': False}], 'image': 'https://bloximages.chicago2.vip.townnews.com/santamariatimes.com/content/tncms/custom/image/b9c888ca-59a2-11eb-a31f-0b4d74fa96dc.jpg?resize=200%2C200', 'eventUri': None, 'sentiment': 0.06666666666666665, 'wgt': 458933083, 'relevance': 51}
{'uri': '8230424587', 'lang': 'eng', 'isDuplicate': True, 'date': '2024-07-17', 'time': '17:24:20', 'dateTime': '2024-07-17T17:24:20Z', 'dateTimePub': '2024-07-17T17:23:43Z', 'dataType': 'news', 'sim': 0, 'url': 'https://halifax.citynews.ca/2024/07/17/lionel-messi-asked-to-apologize-for-argentina-players-racist-chant/', 'title': "Lionel Messi asked to apologize for Argentina players' racist chant", 'body': 'Lionel Messi faced calls on Wednesday to apologize for racist chants made by Argentina\'s players after they won the Copa America.\n\nAn Argentinean government official said Messi, who is the team captain, and the president of the country\'s soccer federation, Claudio Tapia, should apologize after a video was shared on social media showing members of Argentina\'s triumphant squad singing a racist chant about French players with African heritage.\n\nMidfielder Enzo Fernandez said he was "truly sorry" for the incident and his Premier League club Chelsea said it had begun disciplinary action, describing discriminatory behavior as "completely unacceptable."\n\nIt is unclear from the video if Messi -- widely regarded as one of the greatest soccer players of all time -- participated in the chant. But Argentina\'s sports sub-secretary, Julio Garro, said he should say sorry.\n\n"The national team captain must also come out to apologize for this case. The same AFA (Argentina Football Association) president," Garro said in radio statements. "I think it is appropriate. It leaves us as a country in a bad position, with so much glory."\n\nArgentina beat Colombia 1-0 on Sunday at Miami Gardens, Florida. Afterwards a video posted on Instagram showed Fernandez and Argentina players chanting about France\'s team as they celebrated.\n\nThe same chants -- by some Argentina fans -- emerged before the team beat France in the World Cup final in 2022. The derogatory chants single out France players of African heritage, from several countries, and holding a French passport.\n\nFIFA said it was also looking into the incident after the French soccer federation pledged to file a complaint with the sport\'s world governing body over "racist and discriminatory remarks."\n\nChelsea\'s response comes after one of Fernandez\'s clubmates, France defender Wesley Fofana, posted the video on his social media accounts Tuesday and called it "uninhibited racism."\n\nFofana has family ties to Ivory Coast and is among several French players who are Black in the Chelsea first-team squad.\n\n"We are proud to be a diverse, inclusive club where people from all cultures, communities and identities feel welcome," Chelsea said in a statement Wednesday. "We acknowledge and appreciate our player\'s public apology and will use this as an opportunity to educate.\n\n"The Club has instigated an internal disciplinary procedure."\n\nFernandez apologized for "getting caught up in the euphoria of our Copa America celebrations."\n\n"That video, that moment, those words, do not reflect my beliefs or my character," he said on Instagram. "I am truly sorry."\n\nFernandez became the most expensive player in British soccer history after joining Chelsea from Benfica for 106.7 million pounds ($131.4 million) in 2023.\n\nFIFA President Gianni Infantino has said soccer and its 211 national federations must have a zero tolerance approach to racism and in May committed to relaunching a task force to monitor incidents.\n\n"FIFA is aware of a video circulating on social media and the incident is being looked into," the governing body said Wednesday. "FIFA strongly condemns any form of discrimination by anyone including players, fans and officials."\n\nIt is unclear what jurisdiction FIFA has over the incident on a team bus after a tournament, but the governing body likely could act if the Argentina federation\'s handling of the case is considered unsatisfactory.\n\n___\n\nDebora Rey contributed to this story from Buenos Aires', 'source': {'uri': 'halifax.citynews.ca', 'dataType': 'news', 'title': 'CityNews Halifax'}, 'authors': [], 'image': 'https://halifax.citynews.ca/wp-content/blogs.dir/sites/5/2024/07/2ed9767b-54b1-48e2-8107-9dcda2b8ca56.jpg', 'eventUri': None, 'sentiment': 0.06666666666666665, 'wgt': 458933060, 'relevance': 51}

{'uri': '8230423257', 'lang': 'eng', 'isDuplicate': True, 'date': '2024-07-17', 'time': '17:23:05', 'dateTime': '2024-07-17T17:23:05Z', 'dateTimePub': '2024-07-17T17:22:31Z', 'dataType': 'news', 'sim': 0, 'url': 'https://www-tmp.thenational.scot/sport/24456595.martin-hannan-people-always-want-just-ask-gareth-southgate/?ref=rss', 'title': 'Martin Hannan: People always want more, just ask Gareth Southgate', 'body': 'That\'s the trouble with professional sport: you might achieve one aim but people always set you a new and higher target.\n\nAsk Gareth Southgate, a fundamentally decent man who in my opinion over-achieved by getting England to a World Cup semi-final and two European Championship finals. But it wasn\'t enough to satisfy an English nation high on a sense of entitlement to victory and now he\'s gone.\n\nIn the next ten days Scottish rugby faces a similar dilemma. Tonight our under-20 men will take on the USA at the Hive Stadium and having comfortably disposed of Japan after hammering Samoa and Hong Kong China they are just 80 minutes away from returning to the full World Under-20 Championship - and what a tournament in South Africa that\'s been, I may say.\n\nThe trouble is that the match against Japan was billed as the tournament decider and our under-20s are now expected to do to their American opponents what the full national squad did to the USA in Washington at the weekend.\n\nOn paper, Scotland should win cosily, and with head coach Kenny Murray having to make only one injury-enforced change - Ruaraidh Hart for Ryan Burke - he will show that consistency of selection gives strength to the squad.\n\nRead more:\n\nI have watched several of the young Scots grow into their roles during the tournament. Liam McConnell has been an outstanding captain alongside fellow back row workhorses Tom Currie and Freddy Douglas. Fergus Watson has been superb at full-back, and Geordie Gwynn and Finlay Doyle are wingers who can run and tackle with the best of them. Centres Findlay Thomson and John Ventisei are equally good in defence or attack.\n\nAndrew MacLean and Conor McAlpine have forged a formidable partnership at 9 and 10, while the front row of Robbie Deans and the Blyth-Lafferty brothers are surely future full caps. Rounding out the 14 who keep their places from Friday is lock forward Euan McVie which means that seven of the pack are products of Edinburgh Rugby\'s pro-Academy. And nearly all the squad played some part in the now defunct Super Series so when can we learn how that gap is going to be filled?\n\nThe young Americans are a good-well drilled side but I think they lack strength in depth while Murray can look to his bench and know that there is real talent there, with the likes of Seb Stephen, Hector Patterson, Jack Hocking and Dylan Cockburn sure to make an impact when they get on.\n\nI\'m confident that Scotland will prevail tonight but the USA will be a tougher nut to crack.\n\nHalfway through the development tour of the Americas, Scotland\'s national men\'s squad have put themselves in the position of having outclassed Canada and the USA and are thus incandescently hot favourites to beat Chile and Uruguay over the next two weekends. Even changes in personnel have hardly weakened the squad, and the Chileans\' drop to 22nd place in the world rankings - despite beating Belgium and Hong King China over the last two weekends - is indicative of their lowly status. Yet they did at least show up on occasion during last year\'s World Cup, and Los Condores are ranked only behind Argentina and Uruguay in South America. Scotland must beat Chile in Santiago at the weekend, and I\'ll give my verdict on Uruguay next week.\n\nThere is an intriguing connection between Scotland and the Chilean rugby community. Two of the founding fathers of rugby in the country were brothers, Donald and Ian Campbell.\n\nI learned their story back in 2012 when both men were inducted into the International Rugby Board, Hall of Fame. As their names suggest, they were both of Scottish descent, their father Colin born in Argentina but very proud of his Scottish roots. Colin immigrated to Chile and played football for the country, while Donald and Ian, both centres, made their mark on the nascent rugby scene in Santiago prior to the war and after it.\n\nDonald was capped by Chile on their 1938 tour of Argentina before he went to Britain during World War II and joined the RAF, being killed in action in a bombing raid in 1944.\n\nIan Campbell, who died aged 94 in 2022, is recognised as the most important player in the post-war development of Chilean rugby, and at one time the country even threatened to rival Argentina under Campbell\'s leadership.\n\nRead more:\n\nHis Hall of Fame citation stated that Ian "was made captain of Chile at the inaugural South American Championship in 1951 and retired 10 years later, after 14 years of Test rugby. During the 1950s he was acknowledged by both team-mates and opponents alike as perhaps the most skilful player in South America and an outstanding leader of men."\n\nAn intriguing connection between the two countries ahead of an international match which Scotland should win. Put it this way, if they don\'t, Gregor Townsend will have to do a Southgate.', 'source': {'uri': 'www-tmp.thenational.scot', 'dataType': 'news', 'title': 'The National'}, 'authors': [], 'image': 'https://www.thenational.scot/resources/images/18317378/', 'eventUri': None, 'sentiment': 0.2, 'wgt': 458932985, 'relevance': 1}

Viele Kinder waren am Montag zum Trainingsauftakt des Deutschen Meisters zugegen und sangen ein Ständchen für Hofmann.\n\n"Ich habe den Sommer genossen und konnte mal richtig abschalten. Im Urlaub wurde ich viel für die Erfolge der vergangenen Saison beglückwünscht. In diesen Momenten habe ich nochmal realisiert, was wir da überhaupt erreicht haben. Wir haben jetzt eine große Challenge vor uns und wissen einzuordnen, dass es eine einzigartige und außergewöhnliche Saison war. Es wird schwierig, das zu toppen", weiß der besungene Hofmann.\n\nAber, der Routinier gibt aber die Marschrichtung für 2024/25 vor: "Wir wollen gut in die Saison starten. Wir werden erst spät mit allen Spielern zusammen sein und wollen uns in der kurzen Zeit all das erarbeiten, was uns letzte Saison so stark gemacht hat. Dass wir ein gutes Mindset haben, hat man heute direkt im ersten Training gemerkt."\n\nEinige prominente Namen fehlen aktuell noch im Training der "Werkself": Da wären zum einen der spanische Europameister Alejandro Grimaldo und der Gewinner der Copa América: Nach 2021 ist es bereits der zweite Erfolg bei den Südamerika-Meisterschaften für Exequiel Palacios, der 2022 zudem auch noch Weltmeister mit Argentinien wurde.\n\nAuch die deutschen Nationalspieler Jonathan Tah, Robert Andrich und Florian Wirtz weilten noch im Urlaub, ebenso der Schweizer Taktgeber Granit Xhaka. Dafür war in Aleix García schon mal ein Neuzugang mit im Training und holte sich direkt einige Tipps von Coach Alonso ab: Wie gut der baskische Trainer zentrale Mittelfeldspieler, dort spielte er ja selbst, weiterentwickeln kann, zeigte Alonso ja bei Andrich, Xhaka und Palacios.\n\n"Ich freue mich riesig, dass es wieder losgeht. Die vergangene Saison war ohne Frage wunderschön. Aber eine neue Saison hat immer einen neuen Reiz", sagte Simon Rolfes, Geschäftsführer Sport der Leverkusener. "Wir werden neue Herausforderungen und neue Chancen haben", ist sich Rolfes sicher. Man darf gespannt sein, ob die "Werkself" ihre historische Double-Saison, ohne Niederlage in Bundesliga und DFB-Pokal, wiederholen kann. {'uri': '8230420539', 'lang': 'eng', 'isDuplicate': True, 'date': '2024-07-17', 'time': '17:20:55', 'dateTime': '2024-07-17T17:20:55Z', 'dateTimePub': '2024-07-17T17:20:01Z', 'dataType': 'news', 'sim': 0, 'url': 'http://hosted.ap.org/article/b6ff158f5d9045eafe0b567f2fcd8785/lionel-messi-asked-apologize-argentina-players-racist', 'title': "Lionel Messi asked to apologize for Argentina players' racist chant", 'body': 'Lionel Messi faced calls on Wednesday to apologize for racist chants made by Argentina\'s players after they won the Copa America.\n\nAn Argentinean government official said Messi, who is the team captain, and the president of the country\'s soccer federation, Claudio Tapia, should apologize after a video was shared on social media showing members of Argentina\'s triumphant squad singing a racist chant about French players with African heritage.\n\nMidfielder Enzo Fernandez said he was "truly sorry" for the incident and his Premier League club Chelsea said it had begun disciplinary action, describing discriminatory behavior as "completely unacceptable."\n\nIt is unclear from the video if Messi -- widely regarded as one of the greatest soccer players of all time -- participated in the chant. But Argentina\'s sports sub-secretary, Julio Garro, said he should say sorry.\n\n"The national team captain must also come out to apologize for this case. The same AFA (Argentina Football Association) president," Garro said in radio statements. "I think it is appropriate. It leaves us as a country in a bad position, with so much glory."\n\nArgentina beat Colombia 1-0 on Sunday at Miami Gardens, Florida. Afterwards a video posted on Instagram showed Fernandez and Argentina players chanting about France\'s team as they celebrated.\n\nThe same chants -- by some Argentina fans -- emerged before the team beat France in the World Cup final in 2022. The derogatory chants single out France players of African heritage, from several countries, and holding a French passport.\n\nFIFA said it was also looking into the incident after the French soccer federation pledged to file a complaint with the sport\'s world governing body over "racist and discriminatory remarks."\n\nChelsea\'s response comes after one of Fernandez\'s clubmates, France defender Wesley Fofana, posted the video on his social media accounts Tuesday and called it "uninhibited racism."\n\nFofana has family ties to Ivory Coast and is among several French players who are Black in the Chelsea first-team squad.\n\n"We are proud to be a diverse, inclusive club where people from all cultures, communities and identities feel welcome," Chelsea said in a statement Wednesday. "We acknowledge and appreciate our player\'s public apology and will use this as an opportunity to educate.\n\n"The Club has instigated an internal disciplinary procedure."\n\nFernandez apologized for "getting caught up in the euphoria of our Copa America celebrations."\n\n"That video, that moment, those words, do not reflect my beliefs or my character," he said on Instagram. "I am truly sorry."\n\nFernandez became the most expensive player in British soccer history after joining Chelsea from Benfica for 106.7 million pounds ($131.4 million) in 2023.\n\nFIFA President Gianni Infantino has said soccer and its 211 national federations must have a zero tolerance approach to racism and in May committed to relaunching a task force to monitor incidents.\n\n"FIFA is aware of a video circulating on social media and the incident is being looked into," the governing body said Wednesday. "FIFA strongly condemns any form of discrimination by anyone including players, fans and officials."\n\nIt is unclear what jurisdiction FIFA has over the incident on a team bus after a tournament, but the governing body likely could act if the Argentina federation\'s handling of the case is considered unsatisfactory.\n\n___\n\nDebora Rey contributed to this story from Buenos Aires', 'source': {'uri': 'hosted.ap.org', 'dataType': 'news', 'title': 'Associated Press'}, 'authors': [], 'image': 'summary_large_image', 'eventUri': None, 'sentiment': 0.06666666666666665, 'wgt': 458932855, 'relevance': 51}
{'uri': '8230420701', 'lang': 'spa', 'isDuplicate': False, 'date': '2024-07-17', 'time': '17:20:49', 'dateTime': '2024-07-17T17:20:49Z', 'dateTimePub': '2024-07-17T17:20:15Z', 'dataType': 'news', 'sim': 0.6235294342041016, 'url': 'https://emisorasunidas.com/2024/07/17/conmebol-abre-expediente-disciplinario-a-marcelo-bielsa/', 'title': 'Conmebol abre expediente disciplinario a Marcelo Bielsa', 'body': 'Las duras críticas del entrenador de la Selección de Uruguay a la organización de la Copa América, han llevado a la Conmebol a abrir un expediente disciplinario en su contra.\n\nLa Copa América 2024, que culminó con el bicampeonato de la selección argentina, ha dejado una estela de controversias más allá del terreno de juego. Uno de los episodios más resonantes fue la explosiva conferencia de prensa que ofreció Marcelo Bielsa tras la eliminación de Uruguay en semifinales frente a Colombia. Las duras críticas del entrenador argentino han llevado a la Conmebol a abrir un expediente disciplinario en su contra, según reportaron los medios uruguayos El País y Subrayado.\n\nEl periódico El País informó que la Asociación Uruguaya de Fútbol (AUF) recibió la notificación del expediente disciplinario vía correo electrónico en la noche del martes. La AUF ha indicado que tiene un plazo para preparar la defensa de Bielsa, quien se enfrenta a posibles sanciones por sus declaraciones.\n\nLas críticas de Bielsa surgieron en respuesta a una pregunta sobre posibles sanciones para los futbolistas uruguayos que se enfrentaron a los aficionados colombianos en las tribunas del Bank of America Stadium en Charlotte. El entrenador justificó la reacción de sus jugadores, argumentando que estos defendían a sus familiares ante la falta de seguridad adecuada en el estadio.\n\n"Los jugadores reaccionaron como lo hubiera hecho cualquier ser humano. Si usted ve que hay un proceso para que todo se atenúe, una puerta de escape y prevención, pero ninguna cosa sucede, y están agrediendo a su mujer, a su madre, a un bebé. ¿Cuál va a ser su reacción? ¡Y me pregunta si van a sancionar a los jugadores! Pero por favor", expresó Bielsa durante su vehemente discurso que se prolongó por casi media hora.\n\nEl entrenador rosarino no se limitó a defender a sus jugadores, sino que también lanzó duras críticas a la organización de la Copa América. Bielsa cuestionó el operativo de seguridad y la calidad de los campos de juego, en línea con comentarios previos del entrenador argentino Lionel Scaloni.\n\n"La sanción es para los que los obligaron a actuar así. Y hay que ver si le tenemos miedo a las posibles sanciones... Esto es una caza de brujas", añadió Bielsa, refiriéndose a las posibles sanciones que enfrentarían sus jugadores por los incidentes en las tribunas.\n\nBielsa no es el único entrenador que ha enfrentado sanciones durante esta Copa América. Junto con Ricardo Gareca (Chile), Scaloni (Argentina) y Fernando Batista (Venezuela), Bielsa fue sancionado por ingresar tarde al segundo tiempo de un partido de fase de grupos contra Bolivia. Esto resultó en una suspensión de un partido para Bielsa, impidiéndole dirigir ante Estados Unidos, y una multa de 15 mil dólares para la AUF.\n\nEstas sanciones fueron criticadas especialmente después del alargado entretiempo de la final entre Argentina y Colombia, que se extendió por más de 20 minutos debido a un espectáculo musical de Shakira.\n\nEn paralelo a la defensa de Bielsa, la AUF también trabaja en la defensa de once futbolistas uruguayos investigados por la Conmebol tras los incidentes en las tribunas durante la semifinal contra Colombia. Entre los más complicados se encuentran Darwin Núñez, José María Giménez, Mathías Olivera y Ronald Araújo, según informó El País. Otros jugadores involucrados en la investigación son Rodrigo Bentancur, Facundo Pellistri, Sebastián Cáceres, Santiago Mele, Emiliano Martínez, Matías Viña y Brian Rodríguez.\n\nGastón Tealdi, exvicepresidente de la AUF y abogado, declaró que se ha solicitado una prórroga hasta el 1 de agosto para presentar los descargos pertinentes.', 'source': {'uri': 'emisorasunidas.com', 'dataType': 'news', 'title': 'Emisoras Unidas 89.7FM'}, 'authors': [{'uri': 'christoper_chang@emisorasunidas.com', 'name': 'Christoper Chang', 'type': 'author', 'isAgency': False}], 'image': 'https://static.emisorasunidas.com/uploads/2024/07/marcelo-bielsa-tecnico-uruguay.webp', 'eventUri': 'spa-3548970', 'sentiment': None, 'wgt': 458932849, 'relevance': 75}

It leaves us as a country in a bad position, with so much glory."\n\nArgentina beat Colombia 1-0 on Sunday at Miami Gardens, Florida. Afterwards a video posted on Instagram showed Fernandez and Argentina players chanting about France\'s team as they celebrated.\n\nThe same chants -- by some Argentina fans -- emerged before the team beat France in the World Cup final in 2022. The derogatory chants single out France players of African heritage, from several countries, and holding a French passport.\n\nFIFA said it was also looking into the incident after the French soccer federation pledged to file a complaint with the sport\'s world governing body over "racist and discriminatory remarks."\n\nChelsea\'s response comes after one of Fernandez\'s clubmates, France defender Wesley Fofana, posted the video on his social media accounts Tuesday and called it "uninhibited racism."\n\nFofana has family ties to Ivory Coast and is among several French players who are Black in the Chelsea first-team squad.\n\n"We are proud to be a diverse, inclusive club where people from all cultures, communities and identities feel welcome," Chelsea said in a statement Wednesday. "We acknowledge and appreciate our player\'s public apology and will use this as an opportunity to educate.\n\n"The Club has instigated an internal disciplinary procedure."\n\nFernandez apologized for "getting caught up in the euphoria of our Copa America celebrations."\n\n"That video, that moment, those words, do not reflect my beliefs or my character," he said on Instagram. "I am truly sorry."\n\nFernandez became the most expensive player in British soccer history after joining Chelsea from Benfica for 106.7 million pounds ($131.4 million) in 2023.\n\nFIFA President Gianni Infantino has said soccer and its 211 national federations must have a zero tolerance approach to racism and in May committed to relaunching a task force to monitor incidents.\n\n"FIFA is aware of a video circulating on social media and the incident is being looked into," the governing body said Wednesday. "FIFA strongly condemns any form of discrimination by anyone including players, fans and officials."\n\nIt is unclear what jurisdiction FIFA has over the incident on a team bus after a tournament, but the governing body likely could act if the Argentina federation\'s handling of the case is considered unsatisfactory.\n\n___\n\nDebora Rey contributed to this story from Buenos Aires\n\n___\n\nJames Robson is at https://twitter.com/jamesalanrobson\n\n___\n\nAP soccer: https://apnews.com/hub/soccer', 'source': {'uri': 'news4jax.com', 'dataType': 'news', 'title': 'News 4 Jax'}, 'authors': [{'uri': 'associated_press@news4jax.com', 'name': 'Associated Press', 'type': 'author', 'isAgency': False}, {'uri': 'james_robson@news4jax.com', 'name': 'James Robson', 'type': 'author', 'isAgency': False}], 'image': 'https://res.cloudinary.com/graham-media-group/image/upload/f_auto/q_auto/c_thumb,w_700/v1/media/gmg/ODYGF2ZNGFFDJE7WSCNEGZWCC4.jpg?_a=DATAdtfiZAA0', 'eventUri': None, 'sentiment': 0.08235294117647052, 'wgt': 458932812, 'relevance': 51}
{'uri': '8230418458', 'lang': 'eng', 'isDuplicate': True, 'date': '2024-07-17', 'time': '17:19:34', 'dateTime': '2024-07-17T17:19:34Z', 'dateTimePub': '2024-07-17T17:19:07Z', 'dataType': 'news', 'sim': 0, 'url': 'https://abcnews.go.com/Sports/wireStory/lionel-messi-asked-apologize-argentina-players-racist-chant-112032617', 'title': "Lionel Messi asked to apologize for Argentina players' racist chant", 'body': 'Lionel Messi faced calls on Wednesday to apologize for racist chants made by Argentina\'s players after they won the Copa America.\n\nAn Argentinean government official said Messi, who is the team captain, and the president of the country\'s soccer federation, Claudio Tapia, should apologize after a video was shared on social media showing members of Argentina\'s triumphant squad singing a racist chant about French players with African heritage.\n\nMidfielder Enzo Fernandez said he was "truly sorry" for the incident and his Premier League club Chelsea said it had begun disciplinary action, describing discriminatory behavior as "completely unacceptable."\n\nIt is unclear from the video if Messi -- widely regarded as one of the greatest soccer players of all time -- participated in the chant. But Argentina\'s sports sub-secretary, Julio Garro, said he should say sorry.\n\n"The national team captain must also come out to apologize for this case. The same AFA (Argentina Football Association) president," Garro said in radio statements. "I think it is appropriate. It leaves us as a country in a bad position, with so much glory."\n\nArgentina beat Colombia 1-0 on Sunday at Miami Gardens, Florida. Afterwards a video posted on Instagram showed Fernandez and Argentina players chanting about France\'s team as they celebrated.\n\nThe same chants -- by some Argentina fans -- emerged before the team beat France in the World Cup final in 2022. The derogatory chants single out France players of African heritage, from several countries, and holding a French passport.\n\nFIFA said it was also looking into the incident after the French soccer federation pledged to file a complaint with the sport\'s world governing body over "racist and discriminatory remarks."\n\nChelsea\'s response comes after one of Fernandez\'s clubmates, France defender Wesley Fofana, posted the video on his social media accounts Tuesday and called it "uninhibited racism."\n\nFofana has family ties to Ivory Coast and is among several French players who are Black in the Chelsea first-team squad.\n\n"We are proud to be a diverse, inclusive club where people from all cultures, communities and identities feel welcome," Chelsea said in a statement Wednesday. "We acknowledge and appreciate our player\'s public apology and will use this as an opportunity to educate.\n\n"The Club has instigated an internal disciplinary procedure."\n\nFernandez apologized for "getting caught up in the euphoria of our Copa America celebrations."\n\n"That video, that moment, those words, do not reflect my beliefs or my character," he said on Instagram. "I am truly sorry."\n\nFernandez became the most expensive player in British soccer history after joining Chelsea from Benfica for 106.7 million pounds ($131.4 million) in 2023.\n\nFIFA President Gianni Infantino has said soccer and its 211 national federations must have a zero tolerance approach to racism and in May committed to relaunching a task force to monitor incidents.\n\n"FIFA is aware of a video circulating on social media and the incident is being looked into," the governing body said Wednesday. "FIFA strongly condemns any form of discrimination by anyone including players, fans and officials."\n\nIt is unclear what jurisdiction FIFA has over the incident on a team bus after a tournament, but the governing body likely could act if the Argentina federation\'s handling of the case is considered unsatisfactory.\n\n___\n\nDebora Rey contributed to this story from Buenos Aires', 'source': {'uri': 'abcnews.go.com', 'dataType': 'news', 'title': 'ABC News'}, 'authors': [], 'image': 'https://i.abcnewsfe.com/a/a6a61e7a-5f6e-4682-a0a5-7e505367a7db/wirestory_b6ff158f5d9045eafe0b567f2fcd8785_16x9.jpg?w=1600', 'eventUri': None, 'sentiment': 0.06666666666666665, 'wgt': 458932774, 'relevance': 51}
{'uri': '8230418225', 'lang': 'spa', 'isDuplicate': True, 'date': '2024-07-17', 'time': '17:19:18', 'dateTime': '2024-07-17T17:19:18Z', 'dateTimePub': '2024-07-17T17:18:55Z', 'dataType': 'news', 'sim': 0, 'url': 'https://www.caraotadigital.net/deportes/el-video-viral-de-argentina-celebrando-la-copa-america-por-el-que-la-fifa-abrio-una-investigacion/', 'title': 'El video viral de Argentina celebrando la Copa América por el que la FIFA abrió una investigación', 'body': 'La FIFA inició una investigación sobre un video que muestra a jugadores de Argentina entonando cánticos racistas contra la selección francesa durante las celebraciones de su victoria en la Copa América.\n\nEl video, que se volvió viral en las redes sociales, lo grabó y transmitió en vivo el centrocampista del Chelsea, Enzo Fernández.\n\n"La FIFA condena con firmeza toda forma de discriminación, venga de donde venga, incluidos los jugadores, los hinchas y los responsables", declaró el organismo rector del fútbol mundial en un comunicado. La Federación Francesa de Fútbol (FFF) también condenó los cánticos y anunció que presentará una denuncia por comentarios racistas y discriminatorios.\n\nLos cánticos, que fueron cantados por primera vez por aficionados argentinos durante el Mundial de Qatar 2022, incluyen frases como "juegan en Francia pero son todos de Angola" y hacen referencia a la supuesta nacionalidad de los padres de Kylian Mbappé.\n\nEl compañero de equipo de Fernández en el Chelsea, Wesley Fofana, reaccionó en las redes sociales con la frase: "Fútbol en 2024: racismo desacomplejado". Otros futbolistas franceses también expresaron su indignación y dejaron de seguir a Fernández en Instagram.\n\nFernández se disculpó públicamente por el video afirmando que "la canción incluye un lenguaje muy ofensivo y no hay absolutamente ninguna excusa para estas palabras". En respuesta, el Chelsea reconoció las disculpas del futbolista, pero anunció que iniciará un procedimiento disciplinario interno para analizar la situación.\n\nHasta el momento se desconoce si alguno de los otros implicados enfrentarán procesos similares en sus clubes o con la FIFA.', 'source': {'uri': 'caraotadigital.net', 'dataType': 'news', 'title': 'Noticias de Venezuela y el Mundo - Caraota Digital'}, 'authors': [{'uri': 'angel_david_quintero@caraotadigital.net', 'name': 'Angel David Quintero', 'type': 'author', 'isAgency': False}], 'image': 'https://www.caraotadigital.net/wp-content/uploads/2024/07/Fifa.jpg', 'eventUri': None, 'sentiment': None, 'wgt': 458932758, 'relevance': 51}

But Argentina\'s sports sub-secretary, Julio Garro, said he should say sorry.\n\n"The national team captain must also come out to apologize for this case. Afterwards a video posted on Instagram showed Fernandez and Argentina players chanting about France\'s team as they celebrated.\n\nThe same chants -- by some Argentina fans -- emerged before the team beat France in the World Cup final in 2022. The derogatory chants single out France players of African heritage, from several countries, and holding a French passport.\n\nFIFA said it was also looking into the incident after the French soccer federation pledged to file a complaint with the sport\'s world governing body over "racist and discriminatory remarks."\n\nChelsea\'s response comes after one of Fernandez\'s clubmates, France defender Wesley Fofana, posted the video on his social media accounts Tuesday and called it "uninhibited racism."\n\nFofana has family ties to Ivory Coast and is among several French players who are Black in the Chelsea first-team squad.\n\n"We are proud to be a diverse, inclusive club where people from all cultures, communities and identities feel welcome," Chelsea said in a statement Wednesday. "We acknowledge and appreciate our player\'s public apology and will use this as an opportunity to educate.\n\n"The Club has instigated an internal disciplinary procedure."\n\nFernandez apologized for "getting caught up in the euphoria of our Copa America celebrations."\n\n"That video, that moment, those words, do not reflect my beliefs or my character," he said on Instagram. "I am truly sorry."\n\nFernandez became the most expensive player in British soccer history after joining Chelsea from Benfica for 106.7 million pounds ($131.4 million) in 2023.\n\nFIFA President Gianni Infantino has said soccer and its 211 national federations must have a zero tolerance approach to racism and in May committed to relaunching a task force to monitor incidents.\n\n"FIFA is aware of a video circulating on social media and the incident is being looked into," the governing body said Wednesday. "FIFA strongly condemns any form of discrimination by anyone including players, fans and officials."\n\nIt is unclear what jurisdiction FIFA has over the incident on a team bus after a tournament, but the governing body likely could act if the Argentina federation\'s handling of the case is considered unsatisfactory.\n\n___\n\nDebora Rey contributed to this story from Buenos Aires\n\n___\n\nJames Robson is at https://twitter.com/jamesalanrobson\n\n___\n\nAP soccer: https://apnews.com/hub/soccer', 'source': {'uri': 'click2houston.com', 'dataType': 'news', 'title': 'KPRC'}, 'authors': [{'uri': 'associated_press@click2houston.com', 'name': 'Associated Press', 'type': 'author', 'isAgency': False}, {'uri': 'james_robson@click2houston.com', 'name': 'James Robson', 'type': 'author', 'isAgency': False}], 'image': 'https://res.cloudinary.com/graham-media-group/image/upload/f_auto/q_auto/c_thumb,w_700/v1/media/gmg/ODYGF2ZNGFFDJE7WSCNEGZWCC4.jpg?_a=DATAdtfiZAA0', 'eventUri': None, 'sentiment': 0.08235294117647052, 'wgt': 458932736, 'relevance': 51}
{'uri': '8230416385', 'lang': 'deu', 'isDuplicate': True, 'date': '2024-07-17', 'time': '17:18:45', 'dateTime': '2024-07-17T17:18:45Z', 'dateTimePub': '2024-07-17T17:17:13Z', 'dataType': 'news', 'sim': 0, 'url': 'https://www.lauterbacher-anzeiger.de/sport/fussball/ist-der-stand-fc-bayern-fcb-de-ligt-zu-manchester-united-so-zr-93186166.html', 'title': 'Bayern-Star De Ligt zu Manchester United? So ist der Stand', 'body': 'Matthijs de Ligt steht vor einem Wechsel vom FC Bayern München zu Manchester United. Doch noch müssen finanzielle Details geklärt werden.\n\nMünchen - Matthijs de Ligt wird in der kommenden Saison höchstwahrscheinlich für Manchester United auflaufen. Der Abwehrmann des FC Bayern München und die Red Devils haben sich vollumfänglich geeinigt, er soll einen bis 2029 laufenden Fünf-Jahres-Vertrag mit der Option auf eine weitere Spielzeit unterschreiben. Allerdings müssen sich nun noch die beiden Vereine treffen. Die Gespräche zwischen den Bossen liefen nach fussball.news von Beginn an harmonisch und sehr konstruktiv ab.\n\nBei den Ablöseverhandlungen hatte man noch keine endgültige Einigung erzielt. Manchester ist bereit dazu, im Gesamtpaket 50 Millionen Euro für De Ligt an die Münchner zu überweisen. Allerdings müssen die genauen Modalitäten noch genau erklärt werden. Wie hoch ist der Sockelbetrag? Wie gestalten sich die Boni? Und wichtig ist für United auch die Frage, über welchen Zeitraum sich die Zahlung strecken lässt.\n\nDer englische Traditionsklub wollte den Schlüsseltransfer ursprünglich schon am Wochenende eintüten. Die Verzögerung lässt aber niemanden daran zweifeln, dass der Wechsel von De Ligt über die Bühne geht. Manchester könnte in den kommenden Tagen somit drei ganz wichtige Personalien finalisieren. De Ligt, Manuel Ugarte (Paris Saint-Germain) und Joshua Zirkzee (FC Bologna) würden die Lücken in Abwehr, Mittelfeld und Sturm schließen.\n\nTrainer Erik ten Hag könnte somit nach deren Urlaubsreisen (das Trio war bei Europameisterschaft und Copa America dabei) die Abläufe für die neue Saison einstudieren. Kommt zudem Megatalent Leny Yoro von OSC Lille in den Nordwesten Englands? Diversen Medienberichten zufolge soll man dem französischen Erstligisten bereits 50 Millionen Euro geboten haben. Teile der Klubführung gehen aber davon aus, dass er einen Wechsel zu Real Madrid präferiert.\n\nWichtig: Sollte sich Yoro für Manchester entscheiden, sind zwei Szenarien denkbar. Erstens und das wäre deutlich wahrscheinlicher: Yoro kommt auch dann, wenn De Ligt kommt und wird ein sehr teurer Abwehrspieler Nummer drei im Kader der Red Devils. Oder zweitens: United gelingt es, sich mit Yoro auf einen ablösefreien Transfer zu einigen. Der Vertrag des 18-Jährigen läuft am Saisonende aus.', 'source': {'uri': 'lauterbacher-anzeiger.de', 'dataType': 'news', 'title': 'Lauterbacher Anzeiger'}, 'authors': [], 'image': 'https://www.lauterbacher-anzeiger.de/assets/images/35/78/35078292-matthijs-de-ligt-steht-vor-einem-wechsel-zu-manchester-united-1hfe.jpg', 'eventUri': None, 'sentiment': None, 'wgt': 458932725, 'relevance': 1}

{'uri': '8230416906', 'lang': 'eng', 'isDuplicate': True, 'date': '2024-07-17', 'time': '17:18:18', 'dateTime': '2024-07-17T17:18:18Z', 'dateTimePub': '2024-07-17T17:17:42Z', 'dataType': 'news', 'sim': 0, 'url': 'https://www.clickorlando.com/sports/2024/07/17/lionel-messi-asked-to-apologize-for-argentina-players-racist-chant/', 'title': "Lionel Messi asked to apologize for Argentina players' racist chant", 'body': 'Lionel Messi faced calls on Wednesday to apologize for racist chants made by Argentina\'s players after they won the Copa America.\n\nAn Argentinean government official said Messi, who is the team captain, and the president of the country\'s soccer federation, Claudio Tapia, should apologize after a video was shared on social media showing members of Argentina\'s triumphant squad singing a racist chant about French players with African heritage.\n\nRecommended Videos\n\nMidfielder Enzo Fernandez said he was "truly sorry" for the incident and his Premier League club Chelsea said it had begun disciplinary action, describing discriminatory behavior as "completely unacceptable."\n\nIt is unclear from the video if Messi -- widely regarded as one of the greatest soccer players of all time -- participated in the chant. But Argentina\'s sports sub-secretary, Julio Garro, said he should say sorry.\n\n"The national team captain must also come out to apologize for this case. The same AFA (Argentina Football Association) president," Garro said in radio statements. "I think it is appropriate. It leaves us as a country in a bad position, with so much glory."\n\nArgentina beat Colombia 1-0 on Sunday at Miami Gardens, Florida. Afterwards a video posted on Instagram showed Fernandez and Argentina players chanting about France\'s team as they celebrated.\n\nThe same chants -- by some Argentina fans -- emerged before the team beat France in the World Cup final in 2022. The derogatory chants single out France players of African heritage, from several countries, and holding a French passport.\n\nFIFA said it was also looking into the incident after the French soccer federation pledged to file a complaint with the sport\'s world governing body over "racist and discriminatory remarks."\n\nChelsea\'s response comes after one of Fernandez\'s clubmates, France defender Wesley Fofana, posted the video on his social media accounts Tuesday and called it "uninhibited racism."\n\nFofana has family ties to Ivory Coast and is among several French players who are Black in the Chelsea first-team squad.\n\n"We are proud to be a diverse, inclusive club where people from all cultures, communities and identities feel welcome," Chelsea said in a statement Wednesday. "We acknowledge and appreciate our player\'s public apology and will use this as an opportunity to educate.\n\n"The Club has instigated an internal disciplinary procedure."\n\nFernandez apologized for "getting caught up in the euphoria of our Copa America celebrations."\n\n"That video, that moment, those words, do not reflect my beliefs or my character," he said on Instagram. "I am truly sorry."\n\nFernandez became the most expensive player in British soccer history after joining Chelsea from Benfica for 106.7 million pounds ($131.4 million) in 2023.\n\nFIFA President Gianni Infantino has said soccer and its 211 national federations must have a zero tolerance approach to racism and in May committed to relaunching a task force to monitor incidents.\n\n"FIFA is aware of a video circulating on social media and the incident is being looked into," the governing body said Wednesday. "FIFA strongly condemns any form of discrimination by anyone including players, fans and officials."\n\nIt is unclear what jurisdiction FIFA has over the incident on a team bus after a tournament, but the governing body likely could act if the Argentina federation\'s handling of the case is considered unsatisfactory.\n\n___\n\nDebora Rey contributed to this story from Buenos Aires\n\n___\n\nJames Robson is at https://twitter.com/jamesalanrobson\n\n___\n\nAP soccer: https://apnews.com/hub/soccer', 'source': {'uri': 'clickorlando.com', 'dataType': 'news', 'title': 'WKMG'}, 'authors': [{'uri': 'associated_press@clickorlando.com', 'name': 'Associated Press', 'type': 'author', 'isAgency': True}, {'uri': 'james_robson@clickorlando.com', 'name': 'James Robson', 'type': 'author', 'isAgency': False}], 'image': 'https://res.cloudinary.com/graham-media-group/image/upload/f_auto/q_auto/c_thumb,w_700/v1/media/gmg/ODYGF2ZNGFFDJE7WSCNEGZWCC4.jpg?_a=DATAdtfiZAA0', 'eventUri': None, 'sentiment': 0.08235294117647052, 'wgt': 458932698, 'relevance': 51}

{'uri': '8230415105', 'lang': 'eng', 'isDuplicate': True, 'date': '2024-07-17', 'time': '17:17:06', 'dateTime': '2024-07-17T17:17:06Z', 'dateTimePub': '2024-07-17T17:16:20Z', 'dataType': 'news', 'sim': 0, 'url': 'https://www.news-gazette.com/ap-sports-summarybrief-at-1-03-p-m-edt/article_c9687258-0615-5570-8f2d-a56af6ef4b7b.html', 'title': 'AP Sports SummaryBrief at 1:03 p.m. EDT', 'body': 'Jarren Duran\'s 2-run HR gives AL a 5-3 win over NL in All-Star Game started by rookie pitcher Skenes\n\nARLINGTON, Texas (AP) -- Boston\'s Jarren Duran, the All-Star MVP, hit a tiebreaking two-run homer in the fifth inning and the American League beat the National League 5-3 for its 10th win in the past 11 All-Star Games. Pittsburgh rookie Paul Skenes pitched a hitless first for the NL, twice hitting 100 mph, and Shohei Ohtani hit a three-run homer in the third for a 3-0 lead. Juan Soto hit a two-run double and scored on David Fry\'s single for the AL to tie the score in the third, and Duran went deep off Cincinnati\'s Hunter Greene. Oakland right-hander Mason Miller got the win after throwing a 103.6 mph fastball in his perfect inning. Hard-throwing Cleveland closer Emmanuel Clase struck out two in the ninth for the save.\n\nPaul Skenes says \'I feel like I\'m one of them\' after hitless inning against All-Stars\n\nARLINGTON, Texas (AP) -- Paul Skenes became the fifth rookie to start an All-Star Game, retiring Steven Kwan, Gunnar Henderson and Aaron Judge for the National League in a hitless first inning. The 22-year-old right-hander, who has just 11 big league appearances, started Kwan with a 98.2 mph four-seamer and retired the major league batting leader on a 99.9 mph pitch with an 0-2 count that Kwan popped up. Henderson hit a weak comebacker on a 93.5 mph sinker and Juan Soto worked out a seven-pitch walk. Aaron Judge grounded into a forceout on the next pitch. The American League went on to a 5-3 win over the National League.\n\nParis mayor dips into the Seine River to showcase its improved cleanliness before Olympic events\n\nPARIS (AP) -- After months of anticipation, Paris Mayor Anne Hidalgo took a dip in the Seine River, fulfilling a promise to show the river was clean enough to host open swimming competitions during the 2024 Olympics. Clad in a wetsuit, Hidalgo plunged Wednesday into the river. Paris 2024 chief Tony Estanguet joined her. It\'s part of a broader effort to showcase the river\'s improved cleanliness ahead of the Summer Games which will kick off July 26 and host open-water swimming competitions. Daily water quality tests in early June indicated unsafe levels of E. coli bacteria, followed by recent improvements.\n\nGreat golf and being on the good side of the draw go a long way at the British Open\n\nTROON, Scotland (AP) -- Playing great golf helps at the British Open. It also helps to be on the good side of the draw. That\'s one of the curses and charms of links golf. The British Open is loaded with examples of players who avoid the worst of the weather. That\'s what happened the last time at Royal Troon in 2016. The leading 14 players after two days all came from the same side of the draw. They played late Thursday and early Friday and avoided the worst of the weather. The 152nd edition of the British Open starts on Thursday.\n\nLionel Messi asked to apologize for Argentina players\' racist chant\n\nLionel Messi is facing calls to apologize for racist chants made by Argentina players after they won the Copa America on Sunday. An Argentinean government official said Messi, who is the team captain, and the president of the country\'s soccer federation, Claudio Tapia, should apologize after a video was shared on social media showing members of Argentina\'s triumphant squad singing a racist chant about French players with African heritage. Midfielder Enzo Fernandez said he was "truly sorry" for the incident and his club Chelsea said it had begun disciplinary action. Chelsea said discriminatory behavior was "completely unacceptable."\n\nNick Saban is back at SEC Media Days, six months after retiring and asking the questions now\n\nDALLAS (AP) -- Nick Saban is at SEC Media Days again, six months after retiring as Alabama coach. This time he\'s asking the questions as part of ESPN\'s SEC Network coverage of the four-day event. Saban retired after 17 seasons with the Tide and three decades as a head coach. The seven-time national champion will work for ESPN this season on its "College GameDay" Saturday pregame show. He said he strives to be objective as a broadcaster and steer away from being controversial. Though he already made a headline by picking Georgia and Texas, and not Alabama, to play for the SEC title.\n\nBears agree to deal with quarterback Caleb Williams, AP source says; receiver Rome Odunze signed\n\nCHICAGO (AP) -- The Chicago Bears have locked in their top two rookies, agreeing to four-year contracts with No. 1 overall draft pick Caleb Williams and No. 9 selection Rome Odunze and avoiding any training camp drama with their prized quarterback and receiver. A person familiar with the deal confirmed the agreement with Williams to The Associated Press. The person spoke on the condition of anonymity because the team had not announced the contract. Williams gets a slotted $39.49 million fully guaranteed deal with a $25.5 million signing bonus. The Bears announced Odunze signed. The club has options for 2028 on both players. The Bears are banking on Williams to become the sort of franchise quarterback Chicago has craved for decades.\n\nNBA moves a big step closer to finalizing new 11-year media rights deals\n\nLAS VEGAS (AP) -- The NBA\'s Board of Governors approved the league\'s next media rights deals with Disney, NBC and Amazon Prime Video at its meeting Tuesday, moving the league one giant step closer to finalizing the 11-year agreements that will be worth about $76 billion. Now comes the next, and possibly final, step: seeing if Warner Bros. Discovery will match one of the deals in an effort to extend a relationship with the NBA that dates to the late 1980s. WBD has five days to match, that clock starting to run when it receives the contracts from the league.\n\nMavericks star Kyrie Irving breaks left hand in offseason workout, has surgery\n\nDALLAS (AP) -- Kyrie Irving has a broken left hand that required surgery after getting injured in an offseason workout. The Dallas Mavericks aren\'t providing a timeline for Irving\'s recovery. Irving and Luka Doncic led the Mavericks to the NBA Finals in their first full season together. Boston won the title series in five games. The 32-year-old Irving averaged 25.6 points in 58 games during the regular season while dealing with foot, heel and thumb injuries.\n\nJontay Porter, banned from NBA, is denied permission to resume career in Greece\n\nA federal judge has denied a request by former NBA player Jontay Porter to be allowed to resume his basketball career in Greece while he is awaiting sentencing for his role in a betting scandal that got him banned from the league. Porter, in a letter sent by attorney Jeff Jensen on Tuesday, had asked that some conditions of his bond be modified so that he can get his U.S. passport back, be allowed to travel in Europe and to reside in Patras, Greece. Jensen told the court that Porter would play for the Greek club Promitheas BC. Los toreros hicieron el anuncio oficial, sin embargo, por respeto al jugador y su familia no se dieron detalles de lo ocurrido con el portero.\n\nPor versiones de prensa, no confirmadas por nadie de la institución torera, trascendió que el guardameta habría sufrido una dura caída, se golpeó la cabeza y producto de aquello le originó una muerte cerebral.\n\nCornejo es ahora el tercer jugador canario que fallece estando activo, antes ocurrió con el delantero Carlo Muñoz y Jimmy Izquierdo, ambos por accidente de tránsito.\n\nCarlos Muñoz Martínez, ex delantero de Audaz Octubrino, Filanbanco, Barcelona y la selección nacional, falleció el 26 de diciembre de 1993, en un accidente de tránsito cuando se dirigía al balneario de Playas. Sus mejores momentos futbolísticos los vivió como jugador del club canario, con el que fue finalista de la Copa Libertadores en 1990, semifinalista del mismo torneo en 1992, campeón nacional en 1991. Gozó de gran popularidad entre la afición barcelonista. Una de las generales del estadio Monumental lleva su nombre.\n\nJimmy Izquierdo, zaguero guayaquileño de Liga Deportiva Estudiantil (LDE), Barcelona, y Delfín de Manta, murió el 23 de abril de 1994, después de una larga agonía, producto del accidente de tránsito que sufrió cuando viajaba de Manta rumbo a Guayaquil. Izquierdo se desempeñó como marcador de punta derecha y fue campeón nacional con el equipo amarillo en 1985, 1987 y 1989. Jugó en la selección nacional en varios certámenes, entre ellos la Copa América de Brasil 1989, donde fue figura. {'uri': '8230415106', 'lang': 'eng', 'isDuplicate': True, 'date': '2024-07-17', 'time': '17:16:40', 'dateTime': '2024-07-17T17:16:40Z', 'dateTimePub': '2024-07-17T17:16:20Z', 'dataType': 'news', 'sim': 0, 'url': 'https://www.news-gazette.com/lionel-messi-asked-to-apologize-for-argentina-players-racist-chant/article_54ec9e5a-ef66-5121-b102-0d3ce502b94f.html', 'title': "Lionel Messi asked to apologize for Argentina players' racist chant", 'body': 'Lionel Messi faced calls on Wednesday to apologize for racist chants made by Argentina\'s players after they won the Copa America.\n\nAn Argentinean government official said Messi, who is the team captain, and the president of the country\'s soccer federation, Claudio Tapia, should apologize after a video was shared on social media showing members of Argentina\'s triumphant squad singing a racist chant about French players with African heritage.\n\nMidfielder Enzo Fernandez said he was "truly sorry" for the incident and his Premier League club Chelsea said it had begun disciplinary action, describing discriminatory behavior as "completely unacceptable."\n\nIt is unclear from the video if Messi -- widely regarded as one of the greatest soccer players of all time -- participated in the chant. But Argentina\'s sports sub-secretary, Julio Garro, said he should say sorry.\n\n"The national team captain must also come out to apologize for this case. The same AFA (Argentina Football Association) president," Garro said in radio statements. "I think it is appropriate. It leaves us as a country in a bad position, with so much glory."\n\nArgentina beat Colombia 1-0 on Sunday at Miami Gardens, Florida. Afterwards a video posted on Instagram showed Fernandez and Argentina players chanting about France\'s team as they celebrated.\n\nThe same chants -- by some Argentina fans -- emerged before the team beat France in the World Cup final in 2022. The derogatory chants single out France players of African heritage, from several countries, and holding a French passport.\n\nFIFA said it was also looking into the incident after the French soccer federation pledged to file a complaint with the sport\'s world governing body over "racist and discriminatory remarks."\n\nChelsea\'s response comes after one of Fernandez\'s clubmates, France defender Wesley Fofana, posted the video on his social media accounts Tuesday and called it "uninhibited racism."\n\nFofana has family ties to Ivory Coast and is among several French players who are Black in the Chelsea first-team squad.\n\n"We are proud to be a diverse, inclusive club where people from all cultures, communities and identities feel welcome," Chelsea said in a statement Wednesday. "We acknowledge and appreciate our player\'s public apology and will use this as an opportunity to educate.\n\n"The Club has instigated an internal disciplinary procedure."\n\nFernandez apologized for "getting caught up in the euphoria of our Copa America celebrations."\n\n"That video, that moment, those words, do not reflect my beliefs or my character," he said on Instagram. "I am truly sorry."\n\nFernandez became the most expensive player in British soccer history after joining Chelsea from Benfica for 106.7 million pounds ($131.4 million) in 2023.\n\nFIFA President Gianni Infantino has said soccer and its 211 national federations must have a zero tolerance approach to racism and in May committed to relaunching a task force to monitor incidents.\n\n"FIFA is aware of a video circulating on social media and the incident is being looked into," the governing body said Wednesday. "FIFA strongly condemns any form of discrimination by anyone including players, fans and officials."\n\nIt is unclear what jurisdiction FIFA has over the incident on a team bus after a tournament, but the governing body likely could act if the Argentina federation\'s handling of the case is considered unsatisfactory.\n\nDebora Rey contributed to this story from Buenos Aires\n\nJames Robson is at https://twitter.com/jamesalanrobson\n\nAP soccer: https://apnews.com/hub/soccer', 'source': {'uri': 'news-gazette.com', 'dataType': 'news', 'title': 'The News-Gazette'}, 'authors': [{'uri': 'james_robson@news-gazette.com', 'name': 'James Robson', 'type': 'author', 'isAgency': False}], 'image': 'https://bloximages.newyork1.vip.townnews.com/news-gazette.com/content/tncms/custom/image/e462f33a-3c65-11ec-b3f1-2f038a8f66b4.jpg?resize=600%2C315', 'eventUri': None, 'sentiment': 0.06666666666666665, 'wgt': 458932600, 'relevance': 51}

{'uri': '8230414579', 'lang': 'spa', 'isDuplicate': False, 'date': '2024-07-17', 'time': '17:16:34', 'dateTime': '2024-07-17T17:16:34Z', 'dateTimePub': '2024-07-17T17:15:58Z', 'dataType': 'news', 'sim': 0.5176470875740051, 'url': 'https://www.larepublica.net/noticia/fifa-investiga-canticos-racistas-de-jugadores-argentinos-contra-francia', 'title': 'FIFA investiga cánticos racistas de jugadores argentinos contra Francia', 'body': 'Este miércoles, la FIFA ha iniciado una investigación en respuesta a los cánticos racistas realizados por jugadores de la selección de Argentina contra la selección de Francia durante las celebraciones en el autobús del equipo después de su victoria en la Copa América.\n\n"La FIFA ha tenido conocimiento de un video que circula en redes sociales, y el incidente está siendo objeto de una investigación. La FIFA condena firmemente cualquier forma de discriminación por parte de cualquier persona, incluidos los jugadores, los hinchas y los responsables", expresó la institución según el medio infobae.\n\nEl incidente se difundió en directo a través de las redes sociales por Enzo Fernández, mediocampista argentino. La canción había sido previamente entonada por aficionados durante el Mundial de Catar 2022, donde Messi y compañía le ganó a Francia en los penales.\n\nLa canción incluye frases ofensivas como "juegan en Francia, pero son todos de Angola", comentarios sobre Mbappé y la nacionalidad de sus padres.\n\nLea más: Argentina gana la mejor final en la historia del fútbol y es tricampeona del mundo\n\nPor otro lado, la Federación Francesa de Fútbol reaccionó con firmeza a los comentarios racistas. "El Presidente de la Federación Francesa de Fútbol, Philippe Diallo, condena con la mayor firmeza los inaceptables comentarios racistas y discriminatorios proferidos contra jugadores de la selección francesa en el contexto de una canción entonada por jugadores y seguidores de Argentina tras su victoria en la Copa América y difundida en las redes sociales", detalló según el medio infobae.\n\nAnte la magnitud del escándalo, Fernández se disculpó públicamente en sus redes sociales oponiéndose a la discriminación en todas sus formas. Además, fue enfático en que esas palabras no lo reflejan a él ni a sus creencias.\n\nEl incidente ha generado una ola de reacciones en el mundo del fútbol y ha puesto nuevamente sobre la mesa la necesidad de combatir el racismo en el deporte.', 'source': {'uri': 'larepublica.net', 'dataType': 'news', 'title': 'La República'}, 'authors': [], 'image': 'https://www.larepublica.net/storage/images/2024/07/17/20240717105518.untitled-design.x2.png', 'eventUri': 'spa-3547561', 'sentiment': None, 'wgt': 458932594, 'relevance': 51}
